Reviews.Title: Toshiba 40" calibration settings
Reviews.Author: Elena C.V. "elenart"
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV if calibrated correctly. I was quite frustrated with it in the beginning, looked online and found following settings [...]They worked for me, hope it helps everyone else looking for good calibration.All in all, great purchase for the price.Settings:Set picture mode to preference before making these changes.These settings found in Picture Settings and Advanced Picture Settings:Contrast 96Backlight 52Dynalight OffBrightness 53Color 50 (it's already well-adjusted out of the box)Tint 0 (same as above)Sharpness 1Dnyamic Contrast OffStatic Gamma 0Color Temperature WarmCinema Mode FilmClearframe OffNoise Reduction Settings:DNR OffMPEG Noise Reduction OffTheater Settings:Picture Size Native (very important to switch to this)Auto Aspect Ratio Off

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: Willy_Indy
Reviews.Content: The thing that attracted me to this tv is the fact that it has 3 HDMI inputs while most tv's in this range only offer 2. I really don't understand the thinking that goes behind selling higher end TV's with more HDMI connections. If the tv has internet connectivity built in, that is one LESS HDMI connection that is required, but if you are like me and want to add a streaming network player, you need that extra HDMI connection if you already are using the other 2 for BluRay and satellite receivers.The 2nd selling point was that the screen, while not truly a matte finish, is still much less reflective than the other top brands, especially LG. This was a big consideration for me, as my tv room has a lot of windows.I love the TV's appearance. It is very thin with a modern look. The picture quality is great, and I like the movie mode for watching movies and normal tv dramas and sitcoms, while the 120hz ClearFrame is great for sports, especially fast action sports like Supercross and Formula One.The reason I don't give it 5 stars is the remote. It is crappy looking and feeling, the buttons are bizarrely either over-sensitive or under-sensitive when using the onscreen prompts. Really hit or miss. It needs a better remote, and I am thinking about trying one from the L6200U series when my local big-box store gets them in to see if it will work with the L5200U series as well.One tip: Make sure you download and flash the firmware upgrade from Toshiba's website before you try to scan for local channels with the tuner.

Reviews.Title: Solid picture Solid Price
Reviews.Author: Aaron Trejo
Reviews.Content: The picture is outstanding and very natural, Great contrast, whites are super white and blacks are very deep.  Menu buttons are very responsive, no delay.  Thin frame and a sturdy stand.For the price nothing came close in comparison that is 120hz l.e.d less than 2" thick with clear frame technology.The clear frame technology works great but works via HDMI not the dvi pc connection.  Whats cool about it is that you can have something in clear frame mode AND then set the degree of "camera stabilization", between smooth, standard and off.  So you can avoid the complete soap opera effect by setting it to off instead of smooth.Blue Ray video is jaw dropping indeed, with the clear frame technology applied over Planet Earth the picture seems ultra real and life like.There are a few things about it that are small inconveniences but definitely pale in comparison to the overall deal.-Each input saves display preferences EXCEPT for Game mode-no dedicated game mode button, access quickly through menu.-no start up sound; I enjoyed my Samsung's jingle to confirm the button press was received.I use this as my pc monitor connected via HDMI.$650 after tax from Best Buy.I had to do a lot of color calibrating but I am extremely satisfied with my purchase.I hope this helps as there are not many reviews out about this model.Enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent buy.
Reviews.Author: Nits
Reviews.Content: I shopped around a lot comparing features to every TV out there before I made the decision to buy this TV.I narrowed down my choices in the following order of priority:1) Size2) Picture (image quality, colors & refresh rate)3) Sound4) Screen resolution when Connected to computers5) Sound Output (Auxilarry, Digital or Co-axial)6) # of HDMI ports7) Component jacks8) Smart apps & wi-fiSize is something that every individual will have their own preference on. My comparison came down to Sharp LC42LE540U, Toshiba 40L5200, Samsung UN40EH6000FXZA & Panasonic TC-L42E50. Out of these 4, Sharp had the best picture quality.Picture & Refresh rate: Hardware on Sharp, Panasonic & Samsung is 120 Hz whereas hardware on Toshiba is 60 Hz. Toshiba presents this TV with 120 Hz refresh rate but truly hardware is 60 Hz. I am a die hard football fan so I made sure I watched some really quick forward passes on this TV before I picked it. ClearFrame technology works good on this TV. You may see a few kinks but overall, you will not notice a difference. The image n this TV however was second to Sharp. It was more true. Samsung image appeared good but it was too bright, looked almost like made up image. Picture on this TV looked real as if I was looking through my window.Computer Connectivity: Sharp was a better choice in terms that it allowed connection to computer using a VGA cable and it's screen resolution was 1080p for computers using VGA port. Panasonic & Toshiba only provide resolution up to 768p (also commonly called 720p). 768p is higher than 768p but it is easy for people to understand. Samsung had no VGA port.Wi-fi: Sharp had in-built wi-fi. Panasonic was wi-fi ready. You need to purchase a Panasonic Wifi Dongle to connect to the only USB on TV. Samsung & Toshiba both do not have wi-fi. I was not worried of the Wi-fi because I was going to connect Apple TV to make it wi-fi enabled.Sound: The choice all came down to sound quality for me. I understand that using a Sound bar is cool thing to do with TVs but I want my TV to be able to work without Sound bars too. Sharp was the best choice in every other department except for its appearance and sound. The sound out of sharp was muffled and not easy to relate to. Panasonic on the other hand was barely audible on max vol. Samsung had decent colume coming out but Toshiba was so loud and clear on 34 vol (max 100).Appearance & inputs: I was instantly sold on this Toshiba TV. It has good appearance. It's skinny (thinner than Sharp, Panasonic & Samsung). It has 3 HDMI ports as opposed to 2 in Samsung & 4 in Sharp. It has a composite input to connect your older devices to your TV. Samsung only had HDMI inputs. It has a PC sound input from computer. The best part is that you can choose your input source on your computer. So if you use a VGA to HDMI converter then you don't need to worry about not getting any sound from your TV. You can select HDMI input as video source and PC input as audio source. Vga clarity is good. I have a display port on my computer so I can connect my notebook using HDMI port and get max resolution but for older computers VGA is a must.Sound Outputs: Toshiba TV also has both Digital & Auxiliary sound output. Aux output lets you connect your high intensity BOSE computer speaker system to your TV. I don't know about other but I like having only one good set of BOSE speakers which I can use with both my TV & computer. No need to spend money on 2 separate sets. Samsung had only digital audio output.This TV also has a USB input like other TVsAll in all, this TV has given me the best value for my money.I saw some reviews on software problems with this TV. I also noticed that at times I had video but no Audio.I figured out the problem. It only happens (intermittently) if I use my comcast cable remote to turn the TV off but use TV's remote to turn it back on (or vice versa). I now use only my cable remote to turn tv on or off and I have not seen any software issue with the TV.

Reviews.Title: Best Buy!
Reviews.Author: Joe P.
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of research before purchasing this TV, so I was fairly confident it would be a good set. However, it was even better than I expected.  First, let me say that I was looking for a tv, not a machine that does it all. I did not want 3d, picture-in-picture, or internet connectivity, though I get internet via both Direct TV and my TIVO. The TV itself has a fantastic picture right out of the box. The basic setting for home is so good that I have not yet found a need to tweak it. The sound is loud and clear, and the leveling feature keeps the loud, obnoxious commercials from being too irritating. I have been pleased with the motion reproduction.  Other reviewers have commented on the remote, so let me say that it really works fine, though it is a little bit light weight. Personally, we use the Direct TV remote, so it is not much of an issue, anyway. If you are like me and want a great TV that does what it should without all of the bells and whistles, then you can get this at a reasonable price. I suggest shopping around. Also, i don't normally get extended warranties, but I did this time. Not really sure why, but I did. Finally, let me add that I feel good knowing that I paid half of what my friends with different models did, and I got a TV that I think is better.

Reviews.Title: Best of the best
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: I didnt found any reviews in amazon for this tv so submitting this review to help others make the right choice. I m techno person n I looked through lots of brand like Samsung, Sony, LG, Sharp, Panasonic etc. I wanted a tv with best picture and sound quality. After spending hrs in comparing the picture quality n contrast ratio, I purchase this tv from a nearby store for just 600 including taxes.I found that TOSHIBA has come up with this 2012 model 40L5200U, which has the best sound and great picture with rich colors, the picture looks so real and natural as though u r looking out of the window.I was initially planning to get a Samsung 2012 ES model, but did not like the picture and color in it after comparing both tv in store for hours. Smart features was not a priority for me because I wanted to get an Apple tv with all the Apple devices I have iphone, macbook etc, Airplay mirroring is a great plus.I purchased an apple tv n connect to my TOSHIBA n u wont believe that along with my Bose speakers it became the best SMART TV u can think of. Why to pay extra $200-$300 for getting a smart TV with built in wi-fi when u can get smart devices like apple tv, ruku, smart bluray players for just $100.Really Appreciate TOSHIBA for making this Great TV without the smart features at a reasonable price and giving back the price benefit to the customers, to choose the smart device of their choice.

Reviews.Title: Great value, great TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Njackso7
Reviews.Content: This unit is great! I use Mediabridge 1080p HDMI cables for it, and the picture is RIDICULOUS!!! Video games and Movies are crystal clear from the xbox 360, and blu-ray takes it to another level. For the specs (1080p, LED, 120HZ, 46"), combined with the price of $800 on sale, I simply couldnt find a better deal.It is not a SMARTtv, so if you need that, this model is not for you. I didnt need one because I run all apps through my xbox and ps3. For an HDTV, the speakers are rather impressive, but if you are focusing on having such a great picture and not combining it with some sort of surround sound, shame on you I do not want to hear how much you hate the speakers. I find them more than adequate.When playing through an HDMI input, you have to turn the TV to "game mode" or it will show lag. It takes two seconds and does not bother me one bit.Toshiba has long been known as a great television set maker, and this one falls right in line with that assessment. I am so happy and am feeling zero buyers remorse. This tv is stunning.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, couple of minor complaints.
Reviews.Author: Electronics is Me "Babylon 5 Guy"
Reviews.Content: Set this TV up yesterday, was quite easy. The picture is awesome! Many have complained about the sound, but really does any flat screen TV have great sound? My other TV a Sony 32" doesn't, my friend's Samsung doesn't, nor have I heard great sound on any of them. I put a Coby sound bar on, sounds great now! Has plenty of inputs, would of liked to have something other than 3.5 mm audio output jack, luckily my Coby sound bar had such a connection, a couple of RCA Jacks would of been nice. It does have a digital sound output. My biggest complaint is you can ONLY use the remote that came with it. I can't use my Cable DVR remote. On calls to Time Warner and Toshiba, after about an hour trying to program it myself, no one had a code, and Toshiba said it would be about a year before one was availabe?? Say what! A little bit of a P.I.A. but I guess I can live with it, as really the only functions I really use with the Toshiba remote is volume, to turn it off and on and the occasional video source change. If anyone has gotten it to work with their cable remote please post it, Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: R. Wetmore "Grandpa R."
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV over 2 months ago.  It did not work.  Called Toshiba, they needed an exact purchase date to start a tech support ticket.  I gave them this information.  One month later 1st technician comes out with a new part, replaces it, and the TV still does not work,  they order a 2nd part,  Takes about 1 month,  Tech come out replaces it,  and the TV still does not work.  He changes a different part still does not work.  It has been over 2 months and the TV still only shows Toshiba splash screen.  I call Toshiba directly,  to request a new TV instead,  they say I need to fax a copy of the proof of purchase and they will evaluate my claim???  Excuse me, you have the warranty information, you have the purchase date, you have had techs on site multiple times, yet I still need to go find a PO and fax it to them  They claim in case it is a gift??????  So if it is a gift I guess you do not get it replaced???????????????????  Well we did purchase it, it does not work.  Toshiba is extremely difficult to work with,  I will never buy from this company again, I recommend you stay clear as well, and if by some chance you want to gift one to someone, buy a different brand, because even if it is registered and under warranty it is totally meaningless for a gift.  Bad company, bad tech support!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for what it does.
Reviews.Author: beefy burrito
Reviews.Content: OK so i bought this TV at best buy for about he same price about 3 days ago. Because i am making this review so early since my purchase so that people will have an idea of this tv because it has not ratings besides this one.. that being said i will update. so anyways lets get on with the review. I''l post pics soon later.For starters i was on a budget and before getting any tv i came across over everyone of them online, this tv was just luck but i still looked for reviews from customers and found ZERO so i knew i was taking a chance. I was planning on getting a cheapo westinghouse but when i went to Best Buy somehow this TV cought my attention. I have a 3 year zero percent interest financing plan so i have a while until the tv is mine....Anyways I got it for my small-medium sized room and it looks perfect. not too big if you are looking away from 5+ feet.Specs: This TV is 45.6 inches diagonally. full 1080p (1920x1080) and has clear frame 120hz. It also has 3 HDMI outputs, VGA for pcs, one usb port that only plays music and photos  a component,optical port, and pc in jacks for audio (which i think is just a 3.5 mm jack)This is my first Tv with 120 hz refresh frame and i gotta say i can really see the difference. Also worth noting is that color may not be good out of the box as in some tv channels i saw a warm color so people's faces were red tanned, i tweeked my video settings and i got a much better color.  I've heard Toshiba has awful sound but i am not disappointed with this tv's sound . It sounds a lot louder than its predecessors but for optimal sound i recommend a sound bar or 5.1 which i plan getting( i mean c'mon lets be honest 95% of all HDTV's speakers suck).Pros: It is 1080P,120HZ, has 3 HDMI ports, i am a gamer and this tv has a game mode when connected to an hdmi (without it you would see input lag or a slow responding gaming experience),Cons: i have an old Sony 5.1 with no digital coax or optical so i cant connect it to this unit, i have tried everything from RCA cables to a RCA to 3.5 mm jack and nothing....... this tv only accepts digital so i will have to replace it but hey i was planning on getting blu ray either way.The USB port does NOT play video so that is a con for me so i use my xbox 360's usb ports to play them.the color kinda of fades when moving away from the center but its minimal. i see no difference really when being from an angle but it IS brighter if you watch from the center since this is an LED tv.so far this tv has been great. i gave it 4 stars because of its cons but then again no TV is perfect. so if you think about getting this tv i recommend it if you are on a budget for a big screen. if you have any questions feel free to contact me.  I wish good luck.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------UPDATE APRIL 7 2012: i have found out that the censor is at the middle portion of the tv which is the aero design with the brushed stainless steel metal.... this probably means that if you have a sound bar it may be conflicting.

Reviews.Title: Best value
Reviews.Author: Oleg Mikheev
Reviews.Content: I researched all available LED 120Hz HDTVs in 46-55'' range and this one was the best value I could find.I was expecting some lower class TV for the money that I paid but it appeared that its picture quality is ever better than that of its >$1000 competitors.Remote control is not very good but usable, I will replace it with some universal one.I compared my TV to Samsungs (we've got lots of Samsung HDTVs at work), and I started to LOVE Toshiba's matte screen.Samsungs' glossy screen reflects everything and it acts more like a mirror if it faces window. I've got huge windows in my room so I can't imagine having a glossy screen TV.

Reviews.Title: Picture is good, software is bad.
Reviews.Author: D. Patridge
Reviews.Content: This tv is nice and thin, with great picture. That is the good part.The bad part is the software.  My first tv to ever crash on me.  I just wanted a tv that could change channels and inputs.  Is that really too much to ask?It also did have some edge back lighting problems when the picture was of a very dark or black seen. The corners had slight light bleed through.  Nothing that made it a deal breaker for the price. It was just a little annoying to notice it at times.It crashes when using the built-in tv tuner.  About once ever 2 days.  When it does crash it goes black and then after about a minute the last channel you had comes up. After that last channel comes up then the tv no longer responds to any buttons.  You have to shut the tv off and then turn it back on to be able to use it again.  And it seems to sit there and think a while before actually shutting off.I tried updating the software that you can get from the Toshiba site and it didn't help.  The fact that that you have software updates for your tv now days is just sad.It wasn't real bad, but the cable connection coming out the side  might be a pain depending on the cables you have. The ports are so close to the edge it might look like the cables are coming out the side of the tv.My OLD Toshiba was great, this one was a terrible overall experience.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful picture; some details could be improved
Reviews.Author: Mainiac
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with the picture of this TV, which of course, is the main thing one wants in a TV. It's amazingly crisp and the colors are great. I don't notice any problematic areas of the screen.I'm sort of baffled that it takes 15 seconds to get a picture after hitting the power button the the remote, and wondering if somehow there's some setting that I could change to alter this... but I looked through the menus and didn't see anything relevant. I also find the menus to be non-intuitive, although there's not so many options that you can't just look through them all when searching for a potential option to control.I also find the stand to be surprisingly flimsy and disappointing, and the remote entirely inelegant.FYI: I got the 46" model of this, and I use my TV with a Roku and an internet-enabled BlueRay player for Netflix, Hulu, and rented movies. And also that we recently got an 42" LG TV (LG 42LM6200 42-Inch Cinema 3D 1080p 120Hz LED-LCD HDTV with Smart TV and Six Pairs of 3D Glasses), so I have a recent high-end point of comparison. I like this TV way better than the LG.When all is said and done, I do realize that I prefer that TV manufacturers get the picture right first and that the user interface is a second priority. However, as a technical person, I am disappointed at the lack of attention to the user interface.Pros:1. Beautiful picture.2. Love the slim design.3. Sound is great.Cons:1. Wish the stand were more sturdy and that it rotated.2. Wish the user interface was better, including the weird 15 second startup.3. Wish the remote was sexier.I don't regret this purchase because the picture is totally beautiful. But I do wish those details had been tended to better.A couple of updates, 12/4/12: I just got around to connecting my older receiver and CD player to this, partly because I was curious about the interoperability with older components (no HDMI jacks). And I'm dragging my feet about upgrading the receiver, which I use for my surround sound. (Note: I recently moved, and haven't yet connected all five speakers, so I can't comment on that. Nor have I set things up, yet, to have audio go from the TV to the nice speakers.) Really, this is just a comment that the RGB works fine. That goes straight from the CD player to the TV, and then the sound (optical cable) goes from the CD player to the receiver (not through the TV). I do think this TV might have had more in the way of the older inputs, but I also think it's basically fine, and the bottom line is that I don't have to buy a new receiver right now to use this TV. And when I get another optical cable, it will be easy to go from the TV to the receiver.Update, 12/24/12: I've hooked up the surround sound now, as well as the digital audio from the TV to my receiver. Again, I'm pleased with this TV, and that it works with my ~10yo receiver (again, I'm using digital audio). I love having the surround sound for my internet movies... Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.FWIW, I have found that I'm used to the weird 15-second startup, though I do still find the lack of prompt feedback weird.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely lousy customer support
Reviews.Author: MaryMarvey
Reviews.Content: This has been a great tv for me.  However, if you expect lightening speed service when something goes wrong--forget it.  I have had this tv for 8 months and the picture went out.  I called Toshiba customer service and got hooked up to have this repaired, on site.  It has now been almost two weeks and it is still not repaired because Toshiba REFUSED to overnight the part to the repair service.  Seriously?  This is a multi-billion dollar company and they won't overnight a part?  With this poor customer service, I will never buy another Toshiba electronic ever again. Update-3 wks later.  Part came in, damaged. Tech had to send it back to Toshiba. 4 wks later - Replacement for damaged replacement part in and tech came and installed it.  The TV worked for 3 hours & 50 minutes and then went BLACK. The power board/source has obviously blown and yet another part needs to come from Toshiba and, yes, they again refuse to overnight the part!  Unbelievable!!  08/06/13 - The power board was replaced today.  The TV worked for less than 1 hour and went dead again. I called Toshiba and asked for a replacement of the TV -they refused, even though their warranty specifically states "repair or replacement."  I have filed a claim with the Oregon Department of Justice.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but I'm already claiming my warranty
Reviews.Author: BDH5400
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this TV is amazing, and I love(d) it! But I bought it 4 months ago and it already needs to be replaced, which Toshiba was so nice to do. Here's what I like and don't like:Pros:1. Very nice picture, sports look nice at 120Hz2. Very thin, and looks nice3. Perfect sensitivity touch screen controls4. Decent sound quality5. Excellent customer serviceCons:1. HDMI ports are near the edge of the TV and you can see the cords sticking out from the front of the TV. It looks bad2.There is a lip near where you plug in the HDMIs, so some cords won't go in all the way. They still work, but they're very loose and fall out if you turn the TV3. Touch screen controls have no backlight, so I find myself pressing the wrong button on accident in the dark4. If you want to watch movies or play games, you have to turn the TV back to 60Hz or there will be a lot of video lag. It almost defeats the purpose of a 120Hz TV5. The TV switches itself back to 120Hz everytime you change the input, so if I'm playing Xbox and need to switch inputs6. After only 4 months, my speakers started making a buzzing sound, so I called Toshiba and they said the main board was fried (the main board is the most expensive part, and it's cheaper to replace the entire TV). Luckily I was still under the 1 year warranty and they replaced it for free, but it's the fact that it needed replacing after 4 months is bad.Overall I would rate this TV decent, but I would never buy it again. I paid six hundred for it, and a month later my brother bought a Vizio 47" 3D LED TV for thirty dollars more. His TV hasn't had any problems like mine has, and he's very happy with it. While touchscreen is a cool technology, we don't need it in everything. I can't stand the fact that I have to look at the dark text on the control buttons in order to see what I'm pressing, unlike on a physical button control panel you can memorize what each button does (for example, you could feel for the third button from the bottom and know that button lowers the volume, but it you feel for something on a touchscreen, you end up pressing the wrong things). I'm not much of a complainer and I don't write reviews often, but I'm giving this one an honest review since I feel everyone should be aware of the problems of this TV, and I'm not one of those people who gives a one star review because Amazon shipped it a day later than they were supposed to. If you really want to know the fine details of this TV from someone who isn't over exaggerating, this is the post to read.

Reviews.Title: Wow! The picture is so clear!
Reviews.Author: M. Falkenstine "China Mike"
Reviews.Content: I often benefit from these reviews, so I thought I would give back to the system. We've had this TV for about 2 weeks, and I can't believe how clear the picture is and how much of an improvement it is from our Standard Def. TV. To those who complained in previous reviews about the speakers, I have no idea what they are talking about. The sound is quite clear and we've had no problems. If you don't need all the Smart TV features, this is a great buy. I had thought about getting a Smart TV, but I'm glad I held off. Connected to DirecTV's HD service, there are so many channels, VOD shows, etc that we'll have more than enough to watch!

Reviews.Title: Broken Already!
Reviews.Author: Lewis D. Carley
Reviews.Content: Had this item less than two month and it already needs to be replaced.  Look elsewhere if you want a quality LED TV.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Remote Control
Reviews.Author: d0740
Reviews.Content: This is the fifth Toshiba TV I have purchased, including 3 HD with 2 of them LED models. It seems this model year Toshiba narrowed the model choices and downgraded them as there is nothing in their current line comparable to my previous high-end model purchase made only about a year ago. This model has 2 major concerns. First, when I first set up the TV, I noticed an odor similar to an electrical burn which lasted for weeks when the TV was operating. I noticed a previous reviewer also mentioned a smell, which he described as "chemical". Second, the remote is terrible. Sometimes I have had to press the power button several times to get the TV to come on, and I always have to be directly in front of and near the TV for the remote to operate. Recently, after only about 3 months of owning the set, the remote stopped working altogether. I have been able to turn the power on and off with my cable remote, but it is extremely difficult, if possible at all, to operate the menu functions on the set itself. I am now waiting for a replacement remote.

Reviews.Title: Best value
Reviews.Author: Garrett
Reviews.Content: Toshiba once again delivers the best product for your dollar. It's not the best tv out there, but you won't find an LED of this quality cheaper anywhere else.I did notice the "soap opera" effect right away. Made a couple adjustments in the settings and now everything looks very good.Right away the audio sounded terrible, but I turned off the "dynamic audio" option and that seemed to help quite a bit.So far, pretty happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: You get your moneys worth
Reviews.Author: Gimmesamoore
Reviews.Content: Lets be real about this tv, this is a mid level B brand HDTV. With that being said, you get exactly what you paid for.PROS: Its physical appearance. Its one of the better looking $500-$600 TVs out there, slim with a stylish bezel.Simple to assemble and setup.CONS: The TV does not swivel or tilt. Calibration is mandatory, thanks to the previous reviewer with the picture settings I was able to save time and frustration fixing the horrible picture I saw when it first turned on. I ended up turning off most of the features that are supposed to make the picture "better", but the end result was a better picture. Also if you are using RCA to connect this TV, you have to enable it in the MENU before it works properly.This TV was purchased to replace a 32" first gen flatscreen, so its definitely an upgrade in picture quality, but this TV  does not compare to a sony, samsung, lg, or a vizio of its size. I didnt expect it to but thats why I said earlier you get exactly what you pay for. Ive worked with ALOT of TVs and I would recommend this tv if you pay under $600 for it, and youre not expecting top quality HDTV. Great TV for the spare bedroom, kids bedroom, or parents/grandparents who are new to HD. hope this helped.

Reviews.Title: Back Lighting looked horrible
Reviews.Author: Trevor
Reviews.Content: The television came quickly and was packaged well.Unfortunately the back lights were very visible with any kind of dark picture on the screen.  I would have one white circle on both sides of the screen, together they filled the screen.  I played with the picture settings - no improvement.  I went online and looked up what other people suggested setting the picture settings at - no improvement.After a few days of frustration I phoned Amazon tech support.  They suggested I play with the picture settings.  Once I explained I had done that with no improvement they offered to send me a new Toshiba TV or refund my money.I decided I didn't want to gamlbe on another Toshiba and took the refund.  My wife went to the local electronics store the next day and bought a Sharp Tv.  We payed more but, it looks great.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 50" Led TV
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: I can honestly say this is the best TV I have ever owned. This Toshiba TV has a brilliant picture that captures your eye. Plus it has every kind of input that a person could want. The 120Hz has no blur during fast action. Quality TV and has excellent sound.I can not say enough good things about this LED TV. In the past I always bought Samsung products. This Toshiba 50" Led TV is a great buy for the price and has everything you could ever want from a TV.When they delivered the TV they brought the TV inside and un-boxed my Toshiba to make sure there was no DOA. It was very easy to set up. Great service, Great picture, Great sound, and Great Price.. I truly love this Toshiba LED TV..Thank You Amazon for the super fast shipping and service..

Reviews.Title: I CANNOT BELIEVE THIS TV IS ONLY $699...!!!
Reviews.Author: TravellingBuckeye "business owner"
Reviews.Content: I can't believe it... a 50" 1080p 120hz LED television for $699?And with Amazon Prime, they delivered it for FREE, carried it inside, and hauled the box away...!Fantastic, incredible TV.  Beautiful picture.  Great depth (looks 3D at times).  Stunning resolution.Probably the best bargain in electronics I've gotten in years, or maybe ever.An absolutely incredible television for the price.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV...
Reviews.Author: Spike Bottleton
Reviews.Content: I don't really use the "extra" things included, but what I can say is the sound, out of such a thin TV, is solid.  The picture is phenomenal.  I really don't have a negative thing to say other than I believe it's slightly overpriced - but this is a high end TV.  I would buy it again considering my experience.  Really considering buying an identical one for my "man room".

Reviews.Title: Has a high video failure rate
Reviews.Author: Joe rak
Reviews.Content: I purchased a similar Toshiba TV in 46" that I had for 4 years.  The video just went out.  I went online and checked what could be wrong, just to find hundreds of people with the same issue.  You may be one of the ones that keep your video, but if you like a "robust" TV that will last more than 5 years, you might want to check elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Perfection in a television set
Reviews.Author: Bob T.
Reviews.Content: Did no adjusting. Every channel is perfect. Color the best I have seen. Sound is tremendous.I ran old DVD's and they were even better than my old 32 inch xbr set.... And it is myfirst 50 inch set and I did not expect the quality I found in this Toshiba TV.

Reviews.Title: Not saving settings on 2 out of 3 TV's I bought
Reviews.Author: Dennis A. Blair
Reviews.Content: We are using 3 of these TV's for our conference room setup (using Eyefinity).  The TV's are nice, but 2 of the 3 won't save the settings after they go to sleep (Game Mode, and Pic Size Native).The connection to the computer is different for the one TV that works, so I think it's responding to the signal that it's getting, just wish I could over-ride that.  Called Toshiba, but after an hour of him trying to Register the product (required before you can get support) they hung up on me.  See in their forum others having the same problem, but no resolution from Toshiba.We install these setups as part of our business, so was looking at 30 or more TV's in the next year so will have to look for another brand.Picture quality is very good, and when in Game Mode all the picture processing is off so it responds beautifully.  Price was very good, and they mate up side-by-side very well (outside screens are tilted in).

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV
Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple LED of good quality and a fair price...Found it with this model!Did some adjusting to get the picture where I wanted it and I've been very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great "Just a TV" TV
Reviews.Author: N. Nakao "N. N."
Reviews.Content: Setup:  Cable box to HDMI.  PS3 to HDMI.  Apple TV to HDMI.  Wii to Composite (I think.  Could be component.....  Didn't feel like researching the different.  Basically it's the Yr, Yb, Yg and L/R).Couldn't say enough good things.  The first review I read states their recommended settings and, after setting it that way, it's one beautiful set.We live in an apartment and the TV is approx. 9' away and at that distance, 46" is perfect.I did try to play Black Ops II at 9' and I did get motion sick but in sitting approx. 6'-7' away, no sickness but need to get used to a larger peripheral world (left a 32" Samsung for this 46" beauty).Haven't tried any Blu Ray on it but if its better than the pumped in 1080p from the HDMI cable box, I can't wait.I look forward to others' reviews and learning what others think of it.  In my opinion, for a $550 (Costco) "Just a TV, TV" (no "Apps" or 3D), it would get more than 5 stars in my opinion.Also, for those who got lemons I'd like to just say that, working in a tech field, hardware is one piece of the puzzle.  How it is shipped, handled, installed, and owned is a big factor.  Also, there are lemons out there.  It happens.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: M. Mullins "Book to Book"
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV at Costco for $549. At that price it's a steal. Not much in the way of features, but the picture quality is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Nice tv
Reviews.Author: Winter Lyn Cohen
Reviews.Content: Good picture, easy to put together. I got the set up and running in under an hour. I am 50 something single woman, so this was important to me.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded My Expectations!!!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money! Slim and light, nice and contemporary design, solid colors, outstanding contrast and brightness, sharp HD picture once calibrated properly. You do not really need any smart features or WiFi, simply connect your TV to your PC/Laptop via an HDMI cable. The only thing that I can possibly complain about is the dated-looking remote without a back-light and a very basic menu with not very many options.

Reviews.Title: My first HDTV/LED TV
Reviews.Author: Jimbama
Reviews.Content: Box came earlier than I expected.  Corner of box was dented.  Was worried TV might've been damaged but all was fine.  TV was easy to set up and navigate.  Great picture.  Nice that it has a couple extra HDMI slots to work with.All in all, I think this TV is a great value and I'm very happy with it.P.S.  I baled on my potential Samsung TV purchase because of its recent problems with faulty capacitators.  Why  reward a company that uses faulty parts then drags its feet in helping its customers.  Not cool, Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the price..
Reviews.Author: Tyr
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV shortly after our TV died on Thanksgiving day.  No boring tech specs here.  The package arrived one day earlier than expected, Kudos to Amazon and UPS.  The TV arrived in good shape.  Upon opening the box, the base stand was first to come out; it has a fair amount of weight to it to help support this 40" TV.  The screen easily connected to the base stand with four hefty screws...quite easy for one person to put together alone...took all of five minutes and that was with two kids climbing on me while putting it together.  Once assembled and powered on, setup was a breeze thanks to it's auto-startup and scan.  The TV found our cable signal and cable box quickly and without any problems.  I have read reviews of custom settings everyone recommends for this size, but to be honest my family and I were quite happy with it right out of the box.The remote does feel a bit on the medium size compared to current day trends.  The sound from the built-in speakers is IMHO is better than any previous speakers I have noted on any LED/LCD televisions.  With that being said, I will be investing in a sound bar for this TV when I can figure out which one I want.  We like our sound turned up for movies and such,  and that is when you realize that the built-in speakers weren't made for 53 laser guided photon torpedoes blasting across your screen all while a swarm of aliens defend their hive from a herd of mindless attacking zombies.  Also, all of the inputs/ouputs on the back are well laid out and easy to get to EXCEPT for the cable input that you have to twist/screw the connector into the tv....fairly tight squeeze to get my fingers in there and get it connected.I would recommend this TV to anyone interested in a midsize television.  It has a very good picture and more than adequate sound.  It was easy to setup and the remote/on-screen is easy to navigate.  Plus we received an amazing deal of a price on Black Friday.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture, simple setup.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I've had a larger Toshiba for about three years, and thought it was the best a television could be.  Maybe not.  The picture on this new TV seems almost "too real."  Initially, it was good, but I could not get better than 480p resolution - still good.  I finally figured out that 480 was all it was getting from the Blu-Ray player.  Once I figured the settings out on both, it is clearer than looking out the window, at least my windows.I was able to buy this TV and a wi-fi Blu-Ray player for less than the cost of the closest competing (in my opinion) wi-fi TV.  I was looking specifically for the ability to stream Amazon video wirelessly.  The Sony Blu-Ray does that.You'll have to go to support.toshiba.com for the user's guide, or wing it.Michael

Reviews.Title: Wow!
Reviews.Author: Katkeeper
Reviews.Content: Really great colors and clarity on this TV. For me it's a computer monitor, and also an upgrade from a 32' Sharp Aquios. There was nothing wrong with my Sharp so I kinda had some buyer's remorse as I awaited it's delivery. But once I set it up and went right for the BBC - Planet Earth Blue Ray's...I just said WOW! This TV is worth every penny...Amazon has THE BEST price I could find anywhere + free shipping ( 2 day ).~ If I was paying full retail I'd still reccommend Toshiba for both the color and clarity. Hope my feedback helps.( 6 month later update ) I only use this TV as a computer monitor....STILL absolutley love it!!!! Worth every penny. A couple things buyers should know.1. Start up is rather slower. From hitting the on button it takes about 30 secs to power up. I've read some reviews where people say switching channels takes forever...I cant comment on that because I only use 1 channel....but powering up is a REAL slow thing.2. LED is WAYYYYY too clear. When I watch movies or TV shows on this TV I can tell that I am looking at a movie set or a TV set. The colors are so clear and crisp ...the illusion of movies and tv is almost all gone. Not sure if this makes sense...its almost like you can tell its a TV set and not real...really ruined Breaking Bad for me. Great set though...buy it if you can. Fantastic comp monitor!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 40"
Reviews.Author: luvinme
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for about 3 months and the reviews are dead-on! The picture is nice (well...OK) but it takes forever to set it to the way you want it.  After fooling with it for several hours, I finally came back to these reviews and used the recommendations of one of the reviewers.  They were very helpful except that I had to tweak the sharpness more for my taste. I read the reviews that the TV doesn't rotate before I made my purchase thinking that it wasn't that important, but turns out that it is which is why I gave it 4 stars. It just doesn't seem ideal that a 40 inch TV can't be rotated. I also thought the 12 second startup delay was trivial in the previous reviews, but turns out that it is pretty annoying. I don't believe what I got in the box was a manual so I am having a hard time figuring out how to connect a DVD player to it. The sound comes through but not the video.  This is where the problem with just the red & white audio connectors comes in from other reviews that I didn't think was that important, oh but it is!!! I got a good deal on the TV with financing and I needed it before hosting a Thanksgiving Day football watch party so I'm pleased with my purchase.  I may also be a bit spoiled by my Sharp AQUOS and it's unbelievable picture, as well as it's ease of use to tweak settings, rotate, and connect/use a DVD player which makes some of the not-so-important issues with the Toshiba seem bigger than life since nothing I have comes close to the Sharp's exceptional value. One cool feature of this TV that I wanted to add that I wish existed on every TV is that when you click the Mute button, it first drops the volume by half and if you hit it a second time, it will fully Mute but then the Caption appears so you can still keep up with your TV program without the volume.

Reviews.Title: Ties a room together as well as the right rug
Reviews.Author: D. Yates "solitary_dan"
Reviews.Content: One of the best TVs I have owned, and it's only been a few days. Things were frustrating at first as the correct calibration couldn't be found until I saw Elena C.V.'s review with specific settings. Applied them and everything from movies to video games looks like a dream. Thank you, Elena. You have touched my tender heart. Back to the set itself...Pros:Three HDMI inputsTurns on my Blu-ray player when I select the input it is plugged into (it's a Sony, not a Toshiba)Killer refresh rateDecent sound for TV speakersPlenty of customization optionsA screen wider than my ex-wifeSynced easily with my other devices (Sony BDP-S370 and Dish Network HD receiver)Much more pleasant to look at and hear than my ex-wifeScreen doubles as a mirrorCons:Screen doubles as a mirrorReminds me of my ex-wifeDon't let those cons turn you off. Buy this set, because once you turn it on, you won't want to turn it back off. You may find yourself sleeping with the remote too. Hey, it's a much better fit than certain ex-wives.

Reviews.Title: Best value; and best picture of all brands available--by far!
Reviews.Author: Allen Jackson
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Toshiba 50L5200U 50-Inch LED TV.  (Though it applies equally to the 46" model of this same exact one, as I tried that one out for a month as well, with equally great results.)I got mine at a larger Costco with a gigantic TV dept, where I could compare against Samsung, Sony (1 model), Vizeo (which they really push as "best" at several Costcos), LG, Phillips, JVC, and some others I'm forgetting.  And I went to several Costcos, also Best Buy and Video Only.  Spent MANY hours on this!I had no preconceived notions going in, and no biases; I just wanted the best picture quality I could find, at least adequate sound, a good-looking set overall, and least of all (after accomplishing the latter items as the much bigger priority), a good price.  I can say that this Toshiba won handily on ALL of these issues except sound, where it was comparable to most others, though not best.This Toshiba had the sharpest, most beautiful picture BY FAR (with the best, most realistic colors, esp. all-important fleshtones--on white AND black people).  The one I bought and took home is even nicer at home with my Comcast/Infinity HD cable box.  On the HD channels, it simply LOOKS the most clear, sharp, and the most "HD".  Colors are the most realistic--still vivid, but not tending toward brown/yellow/green like the Vizeos and JVCs.  (I spent LOTS of time on the latter two brands, adjusting the tint greatly to get them to be more natural, but to no avail; neither could the salesperson accomplish any better with those two; they have "ugly" pictures in my opinion . . . and I say this as a guy who had LOVED his 1998 tube-type JVC 32" TV for its beautiful and realistic picture, with perfect color and amazing surround sound, too . . . but things have changed with HD, and the manufacturers aren't even the same ones anymore.)This Toshiba has the option of the "dreaded" soap opera look (set Picture Stabilization to "Smooth" for that, "Off" to avoid it), and then any film looks like brand-new VIDEO-- a truly amazing effect, not necessarily to be avoided at all.  Anything "live" and recorded in video (soap operas, nature shows, live sporting events) should be viewed this way, THAT is HOW you get the MOST from an HD TV!  Blu-rays look off the charts on this TV, whether in that "smooth" mode or with it Off!I had purchased the 46" version of this exact model, loved it for ALL the same reasons, but exchanged it for the 50" version to get a bigger screen. They are identical in all respects except for the size--both equally great.  (And I checked how "identical" they are not just via comparing the 46" and 50" TVs, and the instruction manuals, myself; I also called Toshiba customer service and checked on MANY specs between the two sizes.  And THAT person at Toshiba said that everything was identical up and down his spec sheets.)The remote control is uninteresting, but works perfectly.  There are lots of options on this TV for picture quality and a few for sound quality.  The sound is sharp, background noise-free, but only rarely seems "surround-sound-like."  It can get pretty loud, but as with all these flat-screen TVs, not overpowering at its maximum setting.  The sound is fine!  I don't want a sound bar, so having decent sound from the TV was important--and this TV meets that requirement easily.No bells and whistles for this TV--no 3D, or internet, though it does accept PC input.  It's amazing as a TV, not as an alarm clock or as a recipient of streaming movies.  (It, of course, DOES have a sleep timer to set so as to make the TV turn off after a certain number of minutes or hours even, so that it doesn't stay on all night after you've fallen asleep.)The TV, apart from the picture, is extremely attractive (as a piece of furniture, i.e. when turned off!)-- it has a fairly thin bezel, no hanging speaker panel, and is VERY thin from front to back, like 3/4".  An extremely modern, edge-lit LED TV.No, it doesn't swivel on its stand (few do), and yes, it takes like 15 seconds for the picture to come on upon power-up (as do ALL brands and models that I tried).Just a marvelous TV in all respects.  And again, the INCREDIBLE sharpness, realistic colors, and overall beauty of the picture (even when not in "Vivid" mode)--simply blow away the competition at ANY price, including the "great" Samsung. This Toshiba is a superb value ($649 at Costco for this 50" version; the 46" version was just put on sale from $539 to $499!)Great job, Toshiba!

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY A TOSHIBA!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Kristy S. Black
Reviews.Content: I bought this from Amazon in July 2012--- after 6 months the TV stops going on-- so no picture--- I called Amazon, and they said I need to call the distributor-- Thanks Amazon!!!---- So I called Toshiba Tech Support--- after being on hold for 30 minutes-- they hung up on me---I call again a few days later--- the person on the line told me to ship it back and they will see what they can do-- sure let me spend over $100 to ship it to you----- then she came back on the line and said-- oh it's an easy fix over the phone--- Great news, BUT-- I dont have a warranty that applies to tech support over the phone-- WHAT BS is that--- BUT I can buy it for $100 for 1 month--- or $200 for a year warranty--- well LUCKY ME!!!!  I am trying to get it fixed now--- BS-- SHAME SHAME ON YOU!!!!!!!!!  I will NEVER BUY A TOSHIBA!!!!  AMAZON  I really think that you should step in and help!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Defective from the box
Reviews.Author: Esteban
Reviews.Content: Just got this tv out of the box, plug It and there are some white circles all over the screen. Pretty annoying with dark scenes (and no, i am not talking about Batman kinda dark scenes)I live in Costa Rica so i paid over 300 bucks for the intl shipping so Sending It back for a check and back over again its not reasonable. Try to contact Toshiba in Costa Rica but the phone number they post in official webpage Doesnt work.I wrote an email to the seller 2 Days ago. Still no answer.Will update review when they contact me back.For now i Wont recommend this set Maybe was just mine but It Doesnt work Right .

Reviews.Title: Two bad TVs in a row?
Reviews.Author: S. B. Grace
Reviews.Content: I really wish this television had worked.  It had good features and a good picture for as long as it worked.  The first television intermittently cut in and out and could not even make it through the first setup screen to tell it to work in English.  After returning it, I received a replacement from Amazon promptly.  This second TV made it through channel setup and worked about 15-20 minutes when the picture went out and there was only sound.  Shortly after, there was no sound.  Repeated attempts at power up only got menu to show briefly before the picture cut out again.  This one will be returned for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Broke just over a year old!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Locke
Reviews.Content: My TV stopped working when I had it only a year and two months. Screen just went black! Tech Support for Toshiba is pathetic to say the least. Most 18year old kids know more about a tv then they do. Stay away from this manufacturer! I have own several products of theirs and the newer stuff they make is crap! God Bless.

Reviews.Title: Best investment I ever made.
Reviews.Author: Brenda Childs
Reviews.Content: Best investment I ever made. My daughter had bought a Toshiba two year s earlier. The color and clarity and sound made me want one. I had a Somy that I had purchased for twice as much. The Toshiba is far surpassed the Sony for color, sound and clarity.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: got this for my dad a while ago and he has had no problems with it plus he's in love with it as well since he likes big sized tv's with great quality

Reviews.Title: I can't tell you how much I love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: Mr.Obvious520
Reviews.Content: Amazon Warehouse products can save you tons of money!  Where else can you get a 50' TV (with free shipping) for around $530.  Not a bad deal!  Plus the TV is very clear, has solid speakers, and really fills out the living room!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV, especially for GAMING!! Great price!
Reviews.Author: Melissa Long
Reviews.Content: I lived with an ex who paid $2,000+ for this EXACT tv from our local power company! I got a steal!!!!My dad has a Sanyo, my brother has a Hanspree, both 1080p - 120hz.But this one just looks WAY clearer, much for sharp, & clean looking images.This TV also has a gaming mode which I love. I play a lot of on-line games. Especially COD. There is ZERO LAG!I highly recommend this TV to anyone looking for a new TV!This was actually TV purchase, before this I had an old 1992 box 24" TV. So, I was nervous forking out the money. But I am so glad I did. I bought the extra protection too!

Reviews.Title: I Love It
Reviews.Author: Sandra L. Peters
Reviews.Content: Great picture and sound, at a great price.  Only drawback is it takes 5 seconds for channel to update, using my provider.  Never had this happen before, and they said it is do to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Got it as a gift for my in laws
Reviews.Author: ANK2
Reviews.Content: Has very nice picture quality, it takes some time to turn on, doesn't have any apps, but for the price I paid, I'm very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: shade
Reviews.Content: Great product. Super good picture quality and great for watching sports. Used picture configuration from user below with minor tweaks to great results.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Joe Capuano, Jr.
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture quality,  very sharp contrasts.  Purchased on sale and choose this set over a Samsung priced higher. I'd buy it again!

Reviews.Title: Best Value for My Buck...
Reviews.Author: xWCOGx
Reviews.Content: Well I dont often make "big ticket" purchases, so when I AM going to shell out a few hundred dollars, I try to do the required research and comparison shopping before making a decision. I started off with just a couple of basic requirements in my mind; I wanted something small and thin enough to fit in my small room, but something that had a refresh rate highter than 60Hz for gaming, displayed in 1080p. I desperately wanted the TV to be 3D as well, but in the end, decided that it was more gimmicky than anything, and that spending an extra 400 bucks on a comparable TV just to be able to have a feature Id only use once in a while...wouldve been a bad call. On looking at the different TVs on the wall at Best Buy, I also noticed that the LED TVs looked decidedly better. However, the selection of LEDs under $800 or so was slim. Long story short, I was considering going with a VIZIO, so that I could get my 3D also for around the same price, but decided to go with a more established brand (although I hear really good things about VIZIO). Best Buy was also having some sort of sale on this model I believe, so with the 2-year warranty, I believe I ended up out the door having laid down $600 and change, with the TV around $500. For a 40" and above TV in 1080p, the only other Tvs in that price range are going to likely be Dynex or Westinghouse....and Ive already been that route and been woefully unimpressed.Overall, Ive been very pleased with this televsion. Ive had it for I believe a little over a year now. I will admit that I had to return my first one. Starting shortly after I set it up, and becoming increasingly more noticeable as time went on, There were a series of fine, thin, rainbow colored lines coming out from the left hand side of the screen, reaching into the middle. It was a very small section, but still, it annoyed the hell out of me and I dont think I should have to deal with that right out of the box. But Im sure things do get mishandled and kicked around in the warehouses of stores like that, and I had had the foresight to buy the warranty (which is really one of the only things I love about Best Buy), so I hauled it back, and in less than 10 min, I was wheeling out the door with a new one, same model. The second one has worked almost flawlessly, with amazing picture. I head read that I couldnt connect the TV via DVI and get sound, but with an HDMI-DVI adaptor cable, and selecting "TOSHIBA" as default in Sound Manager on my PC, after months of trying to figure out, Im able to Play PC games, Netflix, etc, in stunning quality on this TV (dont forget to select "game mode" to eliminate the lagging response. With Steam's "Big Picture" and a wireless xbox 360 controller, I get all the benefits of console gaming, but in lightning fast 1080p.The only problem ive had with the second replacement television- has been more of an annoyance than a real problem. It happens so infrequently that I really dont mind, considering how pleased I am with my purchase. Every once in a while- like once every 2 or 3 days, in the middle of viewing (maybe something overheating?), the screen goes black for about 20-30 seconds, and doesnt respond to any remote presses or anything. Then, it flashes back to life, except its now on the local hispanic language channel, with some older Mexican man in a feathered headdress, with cactuses and a stuffed eagle, and oils and incense burning, snakeskins and crystals. Either that or telenovellas.  I guess my TV is posessed by a Mexican grandmother. Anyway, after being completely unresponsive for about 5 minutes, it goes back to normal, and I can control it again. It seems like unplugging the TV also does the trick, but like I said- everything else on the TV works fine, and its only a very minor annoyance, considering how problem free everything else with this TV has been. Maybe my viewpoint is a little skewed, but when your last television was a preowned 22" LCD from craigslist that you had to lean a bookshelf against and duct tape the cords into the inputs to keep them steady so they didnt make a loud buzzing noise- this TV feels like heaven.SUMMARY: Great quality picture, great value. Comparable LEDs look to be at around $800-900. With a TV this thin, sound will always be an issue, but it isnt terrible at all, and its fine for most regular, low-volume Tv usage. And you can always look into a soundbar or dedicated computer/ speakers like im doing right now. The remote is definitely a bit cheap and the documentation that came with the TV was severely lacking in explaining the different features. However, after tracking down the model number, I was able to find a lengthly manual on the Toshiba website. Great to hook up to a PC. Great for gaming. at 120Hz, works with aftermarket 3D products. All in all, Im very satisfied with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: excellent picture
Reviews.Author: GDawg
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with the picture at 1080p.  Excellent clarity and color.  Easy to hook up the peripherals, especially with the 3rd HDMI connection. Very thin and lightweight for its size.  Only complaint is that you have to really push the power button on the remote to get it to turn on and off.  But minor issue.  So far, very good tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: good picture but short on automatic features
Reviews.Author: Beach Guy
Reviews.Content: a pretty good picture but every time you switch to a defferent source computer / antenna etc. you have to messwith it to get the full screen back .  all that should be automatic I would think......Also very annoying is that instead ofgetting  a regular  full mute ,  you have to push it twice to shut the commercials off ... I wonder who the geniouswas who came up with that ....  Also mine periodically  losses the  audio  momentarily .... I like Toshiba but ama little dissapointed with this flat screen and will probably look for another brand next time around.

Reviews.Title: A great little TV!
Reviews.Author: R. G. Taylor
Reviews.Content: I had a particular need to fit as much TV as possible into my wife's favorite old entertainment center designed for the old "big screen" CRT TVs.  This was one of only a few 40" class units that had a width dimension under the 37.5" limit.  The thin bezel also provides a very attractive look.  Was hoping the  reviews on the picture quality of this "no frills" set were accurate and I was not disappointed.  By following an early reviewer's recommendation for picture settings, some frustration was no doubt avoided and I was rewarded with a very acceptable picture at a bargain price.  As others have stated, turning off the clear frame 120Hz option produces a superior image for my tastes.  I use these settings for antenna, satellite and DVD inputs.  There is some delay at startup, but nothing to get too worked up about.  I like the 2-step mute button that cycles to half volume, then full mute and then back to full volume - provides an extra choice for handling the loud commercials.  The sound quality is exceptional for a flat panel TV, in my opinion.  No problem at all filling our family room with full sound and rarely need to push it over 10 unless there is extreme ambient noise.  All things considered, a great little TV.

Reviews.Title: takes very long to come on and when you change channels
Reviews.Author: M. Nacey
Reviews.Content: not to happy with the time it takes to come on about 80 sec . and the same when going between channels and to mute you have to click 2 times dont really like it

Reviews.Title: Worth the price
Reviews.Author: W. Perry
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this TV is well worth its price tag. It thinness was it selling point to meHowever, the preset coloring is way off took me a few days of tweaking to get it looking the way I want it since the standard color was way too warm and with no direct way to just reduce the red in the pictures.The speaker on it is not too bad considering that thy're mounted on the bottom, but I don't pay much attention to that since I have a 5.1 computer speaker plug up to itThe base is wide which i like, makes me feel like it won't just fall over any day now.Overall I would recommend this TV to anyone on a tight budget

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Reba A. Matthewson
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price.  I purchased a ROKU since it was not internet ready and it has exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Guy
Reviews.Content: Good TV with a few cons.  Great picture and color when watching blu ray movies and over the air antenna 1080i tv shows, i.e. The Jay Leno Show.  I popped in a Blu ray version of Avatar on a sony bdp s390 and was very impressed with the picture.  The unit has good sound too.  When changing the channels, the remote control has a VERY VERY slow response time.  I've owned 2 of these units brand new and both units had this problem.  I returned the first unit due to "ghosting" or white smearing clouded images when dark black scenes from a movie or a tv show are watched, VERY irratating.  If you're not familar with 'ghosting', do a search and type 'led ghosting'.  Sadly, the 2nd unit I purchased has similar ghosting issues, but not as bad as the first unit; I should be able to tolerate it this time around, though one should not have to considering the fact that hard earned money was spent to pay for the tv.  When watching movies that take up the entire screen, the ghosting blemishes are not noticable, again, only in dark black scenes.  Another thing that is irritating, I believe it's called the stabilitation mode feature.  Make sure you set this mode to off, otherwise, character's movements on screen will appear very video game like, kinda like their movements have a floating look or appear as if their movements are in a slow fast forward motion, if that makes sense to you.  Also, cheap feeling remote controller.  I've yet to use the pc functions on the unit so I can't comment on that quite yet.  Overall, a solid B as a grade.  Try not to pay more than $500 for this unit tax and shipping included.  Paying over $500 for the unit isn't worth it, especially if ghosting images are present.  I'll update this review in the future, hopefully the unit will last.

Reviews.Title: Excellent t.v.
Reviews.Author: KENNY POWERS
Reviews.Content: I've only had this t.v. for a week but so far it's been great. The sound and picture quality are good, the t.v. build itself is super thin and impressive, overall great quality lower end led flat-screen.

Reviews.Title: No frills TV s exactly what I wanted
Reviews.Author: kjmij
Reviews.Content: No smart TV. No 3D. No fancy-dancy settings. Perfect! If you just want a quality TV at a great price without all the extra junk forced on you with other TV's, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: Overall pretty great
Reviews.Author: ifthenelsenull
Reviews.Content: This TV was purchased as a replacement for a plasma which was a little big for the space it was occupying (first world problem).  It's as expected with a great picture, great sound and it was incredibly easy to hang.  It's really thin and light especially compared to the plasma.My only complaint would be the picture is too good.  The picture is so high definition you can identify the green screen on some shows and movies and it looks weird.  The usual description is that it looks too real.  I guess that's a small problem but if you really like old shows that might make you crazier than you'd prefer.

Reviews.Title: good and bad
Reviews.Author: outlaw
Reviews.Content: picture way better than my previous 42'' lcd.now the 120hz claim is not true!  it is a 60hz tv with some enhancing clearframe technology  that simulates 120hz .the worse flashlight  effect on all 4 corners and other areas around the screen!those 2 issues alone made me return this tv!if you have an issue with any of the above don't waste your time buying it because you will return it !i got me a 55'' instead from lg model # 55LM8600 its outstanding and has a ton of things to offer like wifi smart tv,passive 3D with 6 pairs of 3D glasses, it looks frameless no bessel!! picture is excellent i'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: 3 months and problems already.  First and DEFINITELY last Toshiba!
Reviews.Author: J. Curry
Reviews.Content: Avoid this TV and Toshiba in general.  I bought this as a gift for my parents to replace an old, massive behemoth.  Three months in the TV will have huge vertical black bar as if the backlight failed in the center of the screen.  It looks like two mini TVs on the left and right with nothing (faded black) in the middle.  It happens everyday and seems to go away if we leave the TV on for 10-15 mins.  It randomly appears later in the evening.  Based on reviews here it's not worth the $$$ shipping back and forth to Toshiba to wait months only to get another bad TV.  When the symptoms get worse I'll make one attempt with local TV repair and then this garbage gets recycled.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Scott Silvia
Reviews.Content: Great picture, easy settings, ultra slim makes it hug the wall!  Great TV and easy to use!  Use the 1.8 inch thick mount and it works great for mounting!

Reviews.Title: Review Toshiba 40L5200U -- VGA input is only 720p
Reviews.Author: GunFukker
Reviews.Content: Purchased to use with HTPC and immediately discovered that the display does not support 1080p when using the VGA or PC input, rather it is 1366 x 768 resolution. This was discouraging, also discovered that the set needs to have game mode enabled after every power cycle! Also discouraging. Other than that the picture is good, the black on my set is kind of ugly and gray and blotchy, maybe that is the light leaking? Only noticeable in very dark or black picture. Still, I believe this is the largest lowest cost LED 120Hz panel available currently. THese words describe the TV -- Beautiful, nice, smelly (mine stinks bad! Like poison plastic), easy to navigate, disappointing, simple, bright, good, considered returning, a little heavier than expected, cool, 3 stars for lies.The picture is great, the viewing angle is amazing, easy to press buttons on the side.Update 09.22.2012After getting some time to get used to the TV I am fairly satisfied. But there are some noticeable differences from the previous set that I was using that I did not expect. No 1080 support on VGA input, needing to enable 'game mode' every time the TV is powered on has become a nuisance but the speed at which the TV can process menu commands is acceptable and using the remote control is fairly simple. For general entertainment viewing/gaming the picture is enjoyable but the response time is a little low for a lot scenarios that are encountered when using a PC. Any high contrast images actually leave trails as the view is panned or resized, etc. when dark is replaced by light -- fade is highly apparent. The odor released by my set when in operation has filled the home since day of purchase and is not comfortable to breath. Has required frequent house air refreshes and disappointing when 100+ F degrees outside. But the odor is finally lessening after a few weeks. I definitely feel like I should have waited to make a purchase for a set. But I also find enough value to keep the TV.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture! Terrible sound problem...
Reviews.Author: Enigma "HD4me"
Reviews.Content: My 7 year old plasma just went out yesterday. So, I purchased this because of all the positive reviews and because the price was right. I have to say; the picture is a sight to be seen. The sound is a little on the tinny side, but, the TV is only 1 7/8" thick. I'm surprised they fit any speakers in it. My old Panasonic was about 5-6 inches deep, and weighed 93lbs. This only weighs 37lbs. I am further amazed at how simple everything is to set up. TV's have come a long way since I last made that $5000 purchase. Yep, you saw that right. The Panasonic cost that much. I paid $800 for this one. immediately after installation, I put in Ironman on my Blu Ray and was so taken back at the lifelike picture, I just had to write this. I had no interest in getting internet on my TV. I just wanted a good replacement TV for my bedroom. Well, I got it. We watch a lot of TV in the room. Approx. 5-7 hours a night. Hopefully this one will last a little longer. Day one, I'm very happy. It gets 5 stars because of the picture, the price and the set up ease.****Update**** 3-27-13: There is a problem with the sound cutting off about every 5-10 minutes. I've had the sound board replaced twice to no avail. I think I'd go with Samsung next time and pay a little more for a more reliable TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV if you never have a problem
Reviews.Author: Joan "j.qunn"
Reviews.Content: My remote control was not working so I had to deal with Toshiba support.  First of all support team is all foreigners and very hard to understand.  I gave them all my information and then the guy told me he would have someone else call me because he could  not register my TV. BTW I registered it the day I got delivery.  I called a second time and a machine asked for my serial number and I gave it and it was repeated back to me correctly then the machine said I was out of warranty and if I wanted help I would have to pay. I held on till I got a live person and she verified that I was still under warrantee. I received thee calls from different people and had to give all the information over and over. I sent a fax with my information to one party and never heard back on that connection.  I finally gave up and bought a replacement remote on Amazon for around $10.00 - THIS IS POSSIBLY THE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER RECEIVED AND I HAVE HAD SOME HORROR STORIES.  DO NO BUY TOSHIBA!!!

Reviews.Title: never again
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I bought a model 55L6200u had it only a yr and in 7 months It broke down the mother board stopped working I called tech support and they replaced it under warranty 3 months later it broke down again the same part. All this less than a yr i bought the tv. They gave me a service center to fix and it; it is going on a month and it is still not fixed. I called techsupport who connects me to customer relations and spoke to 4 different agents 2 weeks on doing that and now they tell me I have to wait a week to expedite my situation so they can call the service to find out why the Tv is not fixed yet which I have done myself and they still haven't received the part. I don't understand why it is taking so long when it broke down the first time and they fixed in a week. Now I have no Tv. As much as I paid for this product I shouldn't be going thru this. Never again will I buy a Toshiba product.

Reviews.Title: Worst TVs ever made by Toshiba
Reviews.Author: Emad Farraj
Reviews.Content: Worst decision ever to purchase a Toshiba TV 65".  Customer support is the worst ever, I can not believe that these type of poor customer support exist in this country.  They should never be allowed to sell their Junky TVs in the US.  Stay away from ALL Toshiba name brands

Reviews.Title: Good basic TV, pity about the remote.
Reviews.Author: Adrian Saunders
Reviews.Content: This is a basic "un-smart" TV and, in summary, it does its job well.  Picture quality is excellent straight out of the box.  Sound is OK, but we use a sound bar in any case.  With 3 HDMI, plus PC and one RGB, it is well supplied with inputs.  As with some other reviewers, our only complaint is with the really s-l-o-w start up.  It takes a long time for the TV to acknowledge an "on" signal from the remote, even the little green light doesn't come on immediately.  In fact, sometimes it is impossible to get the TV to respond to the remote at all and we have to resort to the side buttons.  To make that easier, I disabled all the button functions except on/off so all we have to do is swipe down the side of the TV switch on.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: mu
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV about a year ago and it is definitely more bang for your buck.  IMO it performs as well as, if not better than many higher end models.

Reviews.Title: Bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: SacEagle
Reviews.Content: Excellent excellent picture quality, very good sound quality, loud, and clear.  Only LED TV I found which does not need speakers. This TV rocks.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Igor Kourzanov
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV for my bedroom, mounted it on the wall. TV works great, picture is great is well. Plugged in my cable box and also my MacBook Pro using an HDMI cable. Thinking of buying this same TV in 50-inch for the living room.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves her new TV
Reviews.Author: High desert jim
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my mother she Loves it.  Good color easy set up. No problems for over a whole  year.

Reviews.Title: Nice and simple. (SmartTV is for suckers)
Reviews.Author: M. Donahoe "programmer"
Reviews.Content: Can take several seconds to power up, but other than that I love it. It is a no-nonsense 1080p TV with 3 HDMI ports. None of that "smartTV" garbage that all the manufacturers are trying to peddle.I especially like the "half-mute" feature, which I hadn't seen before.

Reviews.Title: Great image and price but...
Reviews.Author: Fullmetal_clo
Reviews.Content: I bough Toshiba TV(39L1350UC) beginning of September, online via another retailer. I usually take prolong warranty in store, but somehow I missed the check button somewhere for it. The image is great especially for the price. I bought new wired for my Wii and PS3 (I was still on ACV on my old TV) and the image on my Wii goes on and off as often someone blink his/her eye. I though it was my component wire or my Wii and than I realized my PS3 in HDMI does it too, but just once in a while. So now I just shipped it for repair.For now I give it 3 stars, I like the size, the image and the prize, but I still had to send it for repair a few weeks after getting it.If they repair it fast and well, I'll give it a five stars.But if they don't I say avoid the product. I'll update it when I get it back.

Reviews.Title: super slim and good picture quality
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I bought one of the Toshiba LED LCD TV a while ago in a smaller screen size.This larger size is just perfect to watch movies from my Apple TV. I love the low standby power requirement. Overall a very nice TV that is super slim and easy to mount to a wall (with a special kit).

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 5200U Series tv"s
Reviews.Author: Richard E. Radford
Reviews.Content: I have three of these tv's.  40inch,46inch, and 50 inch. I am very pleased with all of them.  The picture quality is really great and is so clear it almost appears like 3D. I use Dish Network HD for my service.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for good price
Reviews.Author: R. Hoffman
Reviews.Content: I ordered the 50 in from Walt's TV thru Amazon. Arrive with no damage what so ever. Hook up was easy. The HD picture and sound is VERY VERY clear. Sound I keep at 15% and I have slight hearing loss!  I read other people's review saying picture not clear . I think they should check their cable or Sat provider. Had to reconfigure the PS3 for the TV. Now the movies are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: We are very pleased with the TV.  It arrived intact, well packaged.  Minor assembly to get the unit ready.The picture is fantastic.  I would definitely suggest this item to a friend.

Reviews.Title: excellent picture
Reviews.Author: Raymond Holderman "raaymond1"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV for the guest room as a gift for my wife.. Now my wife can watch baseball to her hearts content, and I can watch what I want in the living room. Now we have two large screen TVs and both are great. The old one is 3 years old and giving no problems. This one is 3 months old and is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Thin Profile
Reviews.Author: David Allison
