Reviews.Content: This television is the best value-for-money LED TV on the market.  It's incredibly easy to set up, has plenty of connectivity options, and the picture is crisp!  The audio is decent quality as well.  If you don't need the features of a smart TV then this is your guy!My only (minor) complaint is that the first time they shipped the TV it came with a cracked screen.  Fortunately, Amazon.com returns picked picked the TV back up a few days later and I reordered a new TV from the same company.  It shipped with no problems.I highly recommend this television for any budget savvy shopper looking for a nice-sized, sleek television.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Pic! This LED is Awesome and the picture is better the Samsung!
Reviews.Author: Jocelyn
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this LED TV to anyone that is looking to buy an LED.  Thanks Amazon for all your help with the mess that we went through!!  Great service.Regards,James & Jocelyn GarciaSan Jose, Ca.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Led TV
Reviews.Author: Debra J Winfield
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my guest room - it's looks great, the color is a little darker than I am use too, but overall I love the TV. The regular channels  pops  even though the Verizon set top box is not HDMI. I can't wait until I get my replacement set top box , I may move in the guest room just to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Maximals
Reviews.Content: Super picture without all the smart features or 3D.  1 missing feature for me, Variable output control for the sound bar, damn!  With it, the sound bar would turn up and down with the TV volume.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K.
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV to enter the wide screen world and have really liked it.  Has a good picture and is easy to use.  Has plenty of connections for hooking up gaming systems, DVRs, Blu-Ray player, etc.

Reviews.Title: absolutely satisfied
Reviews.Author: Joseph P. Maryanski Jr.
Reviews.Content: this Tv rocks... crisp, clear, dynamic coloring, a simple remote, yellows are very good... fast action isn't choppy but smooth... we have watched this Tv for about 40 hours now... the recent "Bible' series on History was nothing short of spectacular on this flat screen...and we are more than pleased..Amazon stands behind their refurbished or second market sets... I got a great deal.. had to acquire some missing bolts, washers, and such from a local hardware store... but Amazon credited my purchase accordingly.. and I saved more than $100 over lowest new prices found anywhere.....

Reviews.Title: Happy with purchase of 40 Inch Toshiba
Reviews.Author: MTM
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent, sound is not great, but it is ok. Controls are easy enough to use and set-up is easy. Only complaint is slight delay when changing channels.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Amit Bhuta
Reviews.Content: Was trying to find a reasonably priced 32-40" TV that was less than two inches thick with 1080p and 120hz. This was the least expensive and had a brand name. All others that were even remotely comparable were "no name" brands with poor reviews. The picture, sound, and quality of the tv is so great, I bought another one. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: A great 50 in. set!
Reviews.Author: J. L. Carr
Reviews.Content: Great picture, good sound (although I am using a sound bar with it to further enhance it) and $699. This set was over $1000 in December.  Although it does not have wifi, a $59 Toshiba Bluray will give you that with a Netflix button to go straight to their site.The audio out does not seem to be variable, so that presents a slight problem with a sound bar or exterior audio - you have to use the sound bar's remote to really lower the volume.  I am a big fan of Toshiba televisions.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Xero
Reviews.Content: At default settings, this TV may disappoint.  But when you tweak them a little the colors are just as vibrant as any other top of the line TV out there.  The 120Hz refresh rate is very nice and there are ample inputs for HDMI which is great.  My only peeve is the remote is kind of a pain if you don't have it aimed just right.  Other than that, could not ask for a better TV at this price point!

Reviews.Title: Great deal for no-frills movie viewing, NOT for competitive multiplayer
Reviews.Author: Walking Tree
Reviews.Content: It has strength in exactly what I was looking for; a giant gorgeous picture and it does a great job with 120Hz, certain movies almost look 3D without having to wear glasses and it is lifelike.  A little bit of a green push but I prefer green over red accentuation.  The tinny sound is not a problem because I have a decent sound system to make up for it.  What was disappointing is that 1) this unit will remember all kinds of parameters persistently but game mode always shuts off if you change inputs or power off.  Not too bad to deal with but even with game mode, there appears to be a good 2-4 frames of input lag.  It puts me at a bit of a disadvantage in say Halo 4.  I play with my computer monitor (no input lag) and my roommates old Vizio 42" and there is less lag.  It's still fun to play on but can be irritating to lose scores due to something you can't change.  A minor issue to note is that above backlight settings around 60, there is a TINY bit of backlight bleed at the top but it is almost not worth noting.  Such a great picture.Anyhow overall very satisfied and everyone who watches with me is amazed.  For such a small price and the longevity of LED backlights makes this a great deal.  Just know ahead of time if you want to play seriously against others online this may be a frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: Met my expectations
Reviews.Author: Guy Gundaker
Reviews.Content: The TV met my expectations. It installed easily. I feel the picture quality is excellent. I am a satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: 40L5200U
Reviews.Author: knives
Reviews.Content: Works fine, didn't know what we were missing. We upgraded to HD and got 2 other TVs at the same time. Had Dish do the install, took about an hour and everything when very well.

Reviews.Title: It's a TV
Reviews.Author: Zack
Reviews.Content: Good quality television. Works well for what I use it for. Got it at a good price during the holidays.

Reviews.Title: Great TV !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Richard L. Bell "R Bell"
Reviews.Content: Great TV , compaired to the higher price ones , picture great !!! Easy set up and operation ! Will order again if nessary.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: TONY CASTILLO C.
Reviews.Content: very good tv is so it was describe on amazon web page, is very thicker and has nice colors and amazing

Reviews.Title: Okay for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Lisenbe
Reviews.Content: Overall, its a decent television for the money. Id probably recommend spending a few more dollars and getting a traditional LCD Samsung.Pros:-good viewing angles-cheap-really thin-good brightnessCons:-pretty bad contrast-darks and shadows frequently wash out

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 46" TV
Reviews.Author: Dag
Reviews.Content: This tv is fine for the money. It works great. I have had it about 8 months now with no trouble. It is a low end model. If you want more bells and whistles then you need to get a higher end model but for what it does, this tv does fine

Reviews.Title: Nice price, good quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: babygotsmack "babygotsmack"
Reviews.Content: A good television - it meets my needs in that it has a great price, and the picture is absolutely stunning. The sound quality was a little thin, so I supplemented it with a soundbar.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Good Price
Reviews.Author: AV
Reviews.Content: Once you configure the image settings properly for the room you'll be using it in, you'll find that this TV is a great purchase. The only disappointment is perhaps the sound quality, which I found lacking in richness and depth.

Reviews.Title: Good LED TV but....
Reviews.Author: Hiro
Reviews.Content: I bought a Toshiba 40 LED on Black Friday. It is a good LED TV with a great price. But it has some sort of chemical burning smell when I am watching. I have been using this product for over a month but the chemical smell hasn't gone away. Except that, it is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture, Game Mode sound problematic
Reviews.Author: JennDC
Reviews.Content: The Good: I am pretty confident that this TV has the best quality to price ratio I could have found. The picture is amazing: great contrast, deep blacks (for an LED), and colors that really pop. The design is simple, the screen super thin, the settings easy to control. It has no features to speak of, but I honestly just wanted an amazing picture and I don't care so much about the extras, especially for under $500.The Not-so-Good: My boyfriend and I play a lot of video games so we were really interested to try out Game Mode. As far as the picture goes, it works great; the problem is the sound. We have an old analog stereo system that we hooked up to the TV, and while it works in all of the other modes, the sound shuts off when we enter Game Mode. It appears that Game Mode will only accept digital audio for some reason, so now we are looking into getting a converter. Of course we can still use Game Mode with the built in TV speakers, but they sound pretty bad compared to our stereo and produce a bit of a crackling noise sometimes. The other option is to play games in another mode, which is what we're doing currently, but that means we have to deal with some lag time that makes games feel sluggish. Hopefully the converter will solve this problem.All in all I'm very happy with the purchase. I don't believe there's a TV with better picture quality out there for the price.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture
Reviews.Author: SirBarksAlot
Reviews.Content: We received the TV and half of screen had dead pixels.  Called up Amazon and we had to ship it back.  Unfortunately they didn't have any more of these in stock so we had to return it for our money back.  Which they wouldn't give us until the TV came back.A few weeks later they had another one in stock so we decided to order it and this one actually worked.  Good picture and easy setup.

Reviews.Title: Great set
Reviews.Author: Brett
Reviews.Content: I have had this set for about 6 months and it a great set. Out of the box it need some tweaks with the settings but i found movie mode to be the best starting point( IMO the rest of the preset picture modes look bad). I also tweaked the picture with a calibration disc and noticed a difference. I also don't run the "clearframe" frame interpolation as it adds the "soap opera effect" and i personally am not a fan of it. I also turned off the dynamic contrast and and various noise reduction settings. I do like the dynamic backlight feature with this set, seems to help the contrast from black scenes to white scenes nicer.The styling is very nice, the set is very thing and looks very sleek and modern in your home.Only drawback i see is that being an edge lit set, there is some noticeable backlight bleed around the edges of my set, mostly in the corners. Its only noticeable in a dark room and during dark scenes,but you can turn the backlight down to help with this, i run the backlight lower anyways. (about 30/100)

Reviews.Title: Love LED and picture quality
Reviews.Author: Surinach, JC
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. It has good quality image and for this price you will not get better TV. I am very pleased with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Very, very good TV
Reviews.Author: B. Stayton
Reviews.Content: Great picture with good speaker sound.  Toshiba has always been a solid brand.  If you intend to watch action movies with explosions, etc., you ought to consider a sound bar to get the low frequencies.  But that goes for every led/lcd television.  To keep the TV weight and expense down, they sacrifice the sound system.  But these days, people tend to have some kind of home theater system anyway.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Gary L Dane
Reviews.Content: Picture quality is excellent. Background in scenes in HD is as clear as if you were there. Closest thing I have seen to 3D without the glasses.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy!
Reviews.Author: Bryan Whipple
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with this TV  It is exactly as described.  The only thing I can complain about is that there wasn't a manual included.

Reviews.Title: Great for computer monitor and TV!
Reviews.Author: Chemicalman588
Reviews.Content: I aso use this in my Home theater surround sound, its great to watch movies on. The picture quality can not be beat!I liked it so much I bought a smaller model(24") to use in my ManCave for computer and TV!

Reviews.Title: Toshiba tv
Reviews.Author: Jo Dee Barber "Jo Dee Barber"
Reviews.Content: Awesome flatscreen.  Perfect addition.  Great picture and all around quality. Perfect for video games.  It made a great Christmas present!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Sound's OK
Reviews.Author: Atlanta Kev "Atl Kev"
Reviews.Content: We bought this as a replacement for a 32" behemoth TV.  The HD picture is great.  A wireless network capability would have been nice,  but for the price this was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: great picture, good sound too
Reviews.Author: dukan
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Elena's post, I used the same picture settings and get very good results except I left dynalight on. Overall, I am very pleased with the purchase. It has a great picture, comparable to the Samsung 40" LED but better than LG 42". It looks great too with thin bezel and black piano finish. The sound is plenty good to me given tiny speakers.

Reviews.Title: Excellent television for the price.
Reviews.Author: Marcos Reyes
Reviews.Content: The 40L5200U is an excellent LED set within the $500 price range. Design is very sleek. The border around the set isn't quite as thin as other LED Samsung sets, but unlike the Samsung EH series televisions, it's relatively thin being roughly 1.3 inches thick. Also has 3 HDMI ports, major plus.Image quality is pretty good. Excellent contrast, and very natural colors. However, the only issue I had was with the color accuracy in skin tones. Although with some calibration and tinkering with the settings. I got very good results.Sound quality is very impressive for an LED set. My previous LCD television had decent audio but was often times drowned out from the sound of my air conditioner. The 40L5200U has a fuller sound and the dialog comes out very clearly. Very rarely do I have to pump the volume above 35. Overall I'm liking the set a lot. For the price that I paid, for the image quality that i'm getting. It's a steal.

Reviews.Title: Sleek and Pretty
Reviews.Author: Hobbes
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this TV purchase. My budget was around $500, so it seemed like I was going to have to settle with an LCD at that price, that is until I found this little beauty. I wasn't interested in internet connectivity, built-in Netflix, or all the other bells and whistles that all those new "smart" TVs possess. My PS3 connected to the same network as my PC can do all that and more anyway. What this TV is, and what you pay for, is a great picture, plain and simple. Do the speakers leave something to be desired? Of course, you'd have to be insane to settle for the built-in sound, almost as insane as you'd have to be if you expected the built-in sound to blow you away. I got this set just in time to watch the London Olympics and have been loving it ever since. Long story short:  beautiful picture and decent sound, all wrapped up in a sexy, sleek finish.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: katieshome
Reviews.Content: love the tv.  good price, looks great, arrived on time.  no problems to speak of.  would recommend.  this is my first flat screen tv.

Reviews.Title: This TV is made by a contractor, not Toshiba.  I recommend Panasonic T42E50 or Samsung UN40EH6000
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV as an entertainment hub.  Computer, Blu-ray, and Roku are plugged into a receiver/soundbar system.Computer picture looks awful.  Videos look marginally acceptable.  Color reproduction is average.  Contrast is not good.There is no way to turn off the TV's sound.  So both the sound bar and the TV are making sound!By the way, after some Internet research I found out that the TV was not made by Toshiba's own factory, but by an outsource contractor.This TV is not worth 549 dollars.  There are better choices for slightly higher prices. Bought a Panasonic T42E50 for 599 (also on amazon) and now I am very happy.  The difference is night and day.  T42E50 has some problems with backlight bleeding, but unless the picture is really dark you will not notice it .  I saw a Samsung UN40EH6000 in a store and it looked promising too.  On amazon the price is 649.  I settled with Panasonic since I had good experience with that brand before.

Reviews.Title: Unresalved Problems and Poor Customer Service
Reviews.Author: AMMOKING
Reviews.Content: Has a serious audio problem and they won't repair under warrenty, customer service says it is a minor problem for only a select few TV's.  If you have Dish Network or Direct TV, the audio will become garbled and you will have to turn the TV off and then on again...DON'T BY TOSHIBA!!!

Reviews.Title: I like it.
Reviews.Author: Roger
Reviews.Content: Remote sucks, slow action. Instructions were nearly non-existent. Otherwise, good product; great picture, good sound overall. Could do without the shine on the pedestal, but that is a minor issue.

Reviews.Title: A M A Z I N G
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Perfect right out of the box. This is my third flat screen TV and normally there are adjustments that have to be made to the color settings. Not with this one. I really wish I needed another TV because this one is a no brainer. I have had it for 5 months and have YET to find one thing I do not like. I did not opt to go with a TV with apps because of a blue-ray player I have came loaded with everything I needed.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 40 inch LED TV
Reviews.Author: H the Man
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend Toshiba televisions. This was our second Toshiba 40 inch t.v. purchase. The picture is true to life and setting it up took ten minutes. Great t.v. and the sound is awesome compared to our old box Sony which we could hardly understand. I thought our hearing was going, but finally realized it was the t.v. Highly recommend the Toshiba.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good LED television with a great picture and viewing angle but can do without all the smart features that come on the higher priced televisions then this is the television for you.  The only gripe I have is there is not as many settings you can change for picture/audio etc as other televisions, but overall for the price of this television I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: toshiba
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the TV! it is sleek, slim and light. We love the quality of HD and graphics look great while playing xbox

Reviews.Title: One heck of a bargain
Reviews.Author: JJ in PH
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba replaces a Hitachi that finally died. This is one fine TV, and my friends flip out when I tell them it cost a total of $699. My only complaint is a small one, hence the 5-star rating: the TV takes about 10 seconds to come on. Other than that, the perfect set for the price. I am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Picture
Reviews.Author: Tim D
Reviews.Content: The picture is crisp and clear.  Very light weight.  My favorite TVs.  I had recently purchased two 42" lcd vizio 120 hz from Sam's for more $.  Like the Toshiba here much better.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget option
Reviews.Author: M. Patel
Reviews.Content: I will let the folks a CNET get into the details. But this TV gives you great bang for the buck. If you are like me and did not need/want features like webapps, 3D, local dimming, and 240Hz. This offers great picture quality at a good price.CNET review:[...]

Reviews.Title: best tv for the price
Reviews.Author: rakesh patel
Reviews.Content: great deal for the price. very thin, good picture quality and great price.  I recommend this for anyone that want LED tv but do not want to spend over $600.

Reviews.Title: Execelent TV for the money.
Reviews.Author: Wilma
Reviews.Content: Great picture and so easy to set up this TV. Also compatable with many options. I am an older woman and was able to do the set up myself. Exceptional TV for the money.Toshiba 40L5200U 40-Inch 1080p 1080p 120Hz LED TV (Black)

Reviews.Title: perfect tv for our needs
Reviews.Author: lakebum
Reviews.Content: We just purchased this tv for use in our bedroom and also to use on our annual vacation. It was easy to set up and worked perfectly out of the box. We love the narrow frame around the screen and the thin profile of the TV. The picture and sound are great! My only wish list item would be that it have a detachable power cord. We would recommend this TV to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV!!!
Reviews.Author: barrkayt
Reviews.Content: The TV came really quickly and it was everything we thought it would be.  We checked it out first at Best Buy so we could see the picture quality and it was what we were looking for and the right price.  It is a very thin, sleek TV and we have not experienced any problems.  We also bought an HDMI cable to hook to the XBox and a connector to the laptop so we can watch things from the computer on the TV.  I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Quality HDTV
Reviews.Author: Dave "DM"
Reviews.Content: Clear & crisp TV, thin & small borders. Only wish that there was a few more connections or an extra feature for the price but overall a great buy & what's most important is the picture quality which this excels at, can't go wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: Bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: smudgedlens
Reviews.Content: This TV is cheaper than similar slim models with the same dimensions/specs.  I think the main reason is that it doesn't have any apps on it.  Right now I'm running the thing on bunny ears, enjoying the crappy free channels, so I am not the person to ask about cool stuff you can do with a TV.  But I do have an HDMI adapter for my iPad that I plug into the TV and have been enjoying content that way.Anyway, maybe the apps that come loaded on TVs these days are as awesome as a pack of dogs assembling themselves into a pyramid on a jet ski, and you would have to be a moron to buy a TV without them.  I have no idea about that.  But I do know that this TV has a quality feel to it, is nice and slim, can be mounted very easily on an arm, has several different modes depending on what type of content you're viewing and can bring daytime TV to life in ways that you could never imagine before.In conclusion, I am very happy with this purchase.  I think it's a great deal compared to other similar models as long as you don't need to have apps on everything you touch.  Now maybe my friends will finally come over to watch football at my house.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Jim Loos
Reviews.Content: Everything about this TV is what I could have hoped for.  The shipping was late due to Hurricane Isac, but everything else went great.The TV  out performs my old one Hands-Down.Very satisfied

Reviews.Title: Great picture!  Sound quality very good for a flat panel.
Reviews.Author: Barbara J Halda
Reviews.Content: For the price this has to be the best there is.  I did not need a smart TV nor a 3-D ready, so this fit the bill for me.  Set up is very simple.  The preset settings for the picture are good right out of the box.  Will tweak it after I watch it more and with different lighting.  I was pleasantly surprised by the sound quality.  I had heard horror stories about the poor sound quality from flat panel TV's.  The sound is good.  I increased the bass a little.  I also run sound through an older theater system, but not neccessary for general viewing.  I notice very little glare off the screen and side viewing is not bad but you do lose a little.  The 3 HDMI ports are also a plus.  My son is a fanatic about TV pictures and sound.  He was quite impressed last night.  He thought I made a smart purchase.

Reviews.Title: Does everything you need
Reviews.Author: Jason Mattar
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Easy startup. Sound is good enough for my small room (though if you wanted this tv in a larger room I would suggest speakers or a sound bar). Has enough HDMI inputs. Game Mode works just as advertised.Screen settings need some adjustments out of the box but once you find what you like this TV is great. I also paid only $450 for this set, so try to find the best price

Reviews.Title: Excellent but no timed auto-off
Reviews.Author: Ms. Mo "Mo"
Reviews.Content: This tv has worked out well for the six months that I've owned it. I was replacing a 32 inch 720p LG and the transition was rather seamless. One thing I do miss: LG has an auto-off feature at a specific time at night. So you can set your tv to turn off every night at midnight. That's missing here (there's a sleep timer, but that's annoying to have to reset daily). There's a workaround in that I can set the auto-off feature of my DVR to a specific time and then have the Toshiba auto-off when it loses an HDMI signal. But the LG was just so much more smooth for that one feature.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with this product
Reviews.Author: Lawrence C Lampe
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased on receiving this item in excellent condition and have had no problems what-so-ever with this tv. May be looking for a 3D tv in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Kelly Babcock "Shadowspun"
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price - Good Picture - a little confusing to set up , but we got it set up in a reasonable time.

Reviews.Title: Good value for price
Reviews.Author: Fast400Flyer
Reviews.Content: Easy set up after reading earlier comments.Quality of picture is better than expected.Speakers/sound quality are acceptableConsidering speaker size and output.

Reviews.Title: So nice
Reviews.Author: Andres Munoz
Reviews.Content: It is an outstanding TV. If I would require the TV, I would purchase the very same TV for sure. It is AAA+

Reviews.Title: Love the thing
Reviews.Author: Nater
Reviews.Content: My only issue with this tv so far is that the "Game Mode" setting turns itself off each time you shut the tv off. You will come to find that you NEED that setting on, so if you buy this for gaming you will be turning that setting on each time. Otherwise it's great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for what I paid!
Reviews.Author: Graywolf
Reviews.Content: Only have had it installed for 3 days now but so far so good and love it!Great picture but you DO have to calibrate it.  I used the calibration settings provided by one reviewer here and it is really good so far.  May want to change some settings depending on what you are watching and your room light levels.  Sound to us isn't an issue on this TV...in fact I find that we have to turn to down to 7 or less at times as it is loud.  This depends on the channel you are watching and how it is broadcast I am sure but all in all sound is excellent (unless maybe you live in a cathedral).

Reviews.Title: Good and Bad
Reviews.Author: Z. Huang "BostonianAzn"
Reviews.Content: I wanted a mid-sized slim LED TV as a display extension.  I use it mostly for PC watching movies, ps3 games, and occasional TV.Pro: thin, sleek, good price for what it's worth, good clear picture (still trying to optimize the picture settings).Cons:The TV takes a good 5-10 seconds to power up.It does not save picture setting for each input channel, meaning if I turned off Game Mode for one input, then I turn the TV off, I have to re-disable the Game Mode, which is a big hassle.  This is big for me because I use it mostly as the PC monitor extension and every time I have to disable the Game Mode.The unit didn't come with the M8 screws and for some reason, the wall mount supplier's screws just won't fit in the wall mount, so I had to cut the screws with a powersaw, so if you don't have the resource and you want a wall mount, you might run into trouble.  (the supplier's screws are either 10mm or 20mm and this one uses 16mm, which isnt available in home depot).Overall, I'm happy with the unit, with minor gripes (which may be dealbreakers for some people).  It's a good budget buy for quality, but there's definitely inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: Ive never owned a tv as large as this one, and I couldn't be happier with my first purchase of one! Perfect size for my apartment, excellent picture quality, impressive sound quality for a flat screen, incredibly thin, and very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for such a steal!
Reviews.Author: jwk25
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a couple of weeks ago and it has been perfect for me so far. It has a very sharp picture with excellent colors and wonderful sound quality as well. It's a steal!

Reviews.Title: It' Just a TV!
Reviews.Author: David3peat
Reviews.Content: So I've Had this TV for a week now and I love it. The box was in poor condition BUT the TV has been used so...yea. The picture is great,sound EH?! it's good for movies and shows but cuts out on ONE of my games so it maybe the disc. THe tv is really thin which will be great for mounting later on,for now it's on the base it came with which is very sturdy despite a review I read before.bottom line I just wanted a TV that does what a TV should do and this is it.

Reviews.Title: Had to return
Reviews.Author: Georgia Peachy "southern girl"
Reviews.Content: We did not like this television.  I am not sure if it was damaged in shipping or just poor quality.  The color was terrible when watching tv.  It was fine when watching a disk.  The picture quality was not very good either.  We returned this one and bought an LG plasma which we love!

Reviews.Title: Very good TV
Reviews.Author: E. Ciccia
Reviews.Content: Nothing much to say than great TV for the price. Picture clear and the 120Hz make the TV feel like being at the cinema

Reviews.Title: Great with Dishnetwork - very weak receiver for free TV Broadcasts
Reviews.Author: Wes Obie
Reviews.Content: ProsHooked up to Dish Network I am very pleased with the picture quality. Quite happy with the audio  Also very happy with the number of HDMI connections. Very pleased with price.Con'sVery weak receiver for off the air free TV.  I have yet to find a in home antenna and amplifier that will tune channels 2+ to 5+ or anything higher than channel 29+.  This is important to us during bad weather when Dish cuts out we tune Broadcast Channel 2.4 for weather updates and alerts.My previous TV and the one in our Den had/have no problem tuning all the local channels with just a simple set of rabbit ears and UHF loop.PS - Figured out it was my setup error that was limiting the reception of off Air channels, getting all the channels now very happy with this TV, may order another one.

Reviews.Title: Works Great as Computer Monitor
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to use solely as a computer monitor. For this purpose the 50L5200U is perfect, despite needing a little time getting it set up specifically for a computer. For a computer you need to set "Game Mode" to On and "Pic Size" to Native. Even if you turn off Film Stabilization but don't turn on Game Mode you'll have a significant lag. The TV does save all of these settings on a per-input basis so that you don't need to worry about flipping these features back on.The TV does emit a quiet buzzing sound, though my small 10'x10' office does not help. If you have any audio playing whatsoever, you can't notice the buzz at all. Other reviewers have mentioned backlight bleeding near the edges of the screen - I have not experienced this at all. One small gripe I do have is the lack of blacks this TV can display. Very dark blacks tend to blend a little, but no more than I expect with a LCD in this price range. Other than that, I don't think the colors are too far off.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Color Accuracy, Backlight Bleeding, Flashlighting, Weak Sound, Freezing
Reviews.Author: Kathryn S. Nitz "xboxninja"
Reviews.Content: Just sent this back. Color accuracy was a major problem. Even on the warm setting the picture is still way too blue, and turning the blue drive setting down caused a lot of green tinting. The backlight bleeding coming from the edges of the screen is just terrible and makes some stuff almost unwatchable. For example, in certain scenes where the screen is mostly dark there will be horrible greenish light coming from both edges of the screen, sometimes it's even noticeable on brighter scenes. There's also some pretty bad flashlighting on all 4 corners. The only thing I can see this TV being good for is bright and colorful cartoons. The sound is also pretty terrible. Toshiba tried to hype their Audyssey sound technology but it sucks, my 5 year old 37" 720p LG LCD has way better sound. The TV froze a few times only when I was adjusting the picture settings, weird.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 40" 120Hz LED TV
Reviews.Author: DeannaM
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a 40" 120Hz TV for my living room.  This particular TV was listed as used, but it had exactly the features I was looking for and at the right price (I also purchased the 4-yr protection plan to protect my investment at checkout.)  It was very easy to setup.  I've had it almost a month and I am very pleased with my selection!

Reviews.Title: Stopped working the second day
Reviews.Author: Admir B.
Reviews.Content: When I first got this product it worked great AT FIRST then after the first day it didn't work and when I would turn it on the TV wouldn't, very disappointed I'm never buying from this seller ever again.

Reviews.Title: TOSHIBA WARRENTEE IS WORTHLESS
Reviews.Author: P. Barnhart "DVD addict"
Reviews.Content: Toshiba does not stand behind their products. I bought a toshiba 40" TV model 40L5200u in Dec 2012.After 2 mother board repairs the issue has not been fixed and Toshiba just wants to keep 'repariing'until the warrentee runs out.DO NOT PURCHASE A TOSHIBA anything!"

Reviews.Title: Toshiba 46L5200U
Reviews.Author: TR
Reviews.Content: I had this unit for 3 weeks. It was very, very slow to change channels - as long as 3 seconds. So slow, it was impossible to channel-surf. Twice, because I didn't wait for the picture to display, it took 2 minutes to change stations. To prevent this, I had to make sure not to press the channel button until the picture came on-screen. Very frustrating. The sound was very tinny, which was less an issue for me because I have a sound bar but my wife doesn't use the sound bar enough to be familiar with its operation so she listened thru the TV's speakers.  It didn't have a clock - even though it required time-zone and daylight-savings-time entries. The remote had a cheap feel and was not laid out well so it was cumbersome to use. To change channels by entering the station numbers, the entire number with decimal point had to be entered. Other tvs will take the first number or 2 and take you to the closest station. Much more convenient. The picture was great so I gave it 2 stars but the execution was unacceptable. I returned it. I replaced it with a Samsung that was $260 more but is well worth the money. It has none of the issues mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy LEDs unless...
Reviews.Author: Richard.P "Somebody's going to do it...why no...
Reviews.Content: First thing - LED is not a new technology. It's the same old LCD with a different backlight.I worried about flashlighting and decided to buy a regular LCD however the price on this LED LCD was good so i went for it.Sadly - I can't return this BUT i would do so immediately. My only and biggest problem is the Backlight Flashlighitng effect which is just HORRONDOUS. I should have stick to my thoughts and bought a regular LCD TV.You clearly see on dark scenes an almost halo around the edges of the screen. I've seen flashlighting effects that aren't this bad but this is the worse. I would never recommend this TV to anyone for any reason. I will take a picture and upload. It looks like this image...just a bit more.[...]It's the most annoying thing i've ever seen.If you can't afford Local Dimming LED LCD tvs...stick to original LCD with CCFL backlighting. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: Toshiba Support SCREWED me over!
Reviews.Author: Timmy Hasser
Reviews.Content: This TV has a good picture and that is about all I can say for it.  I called Toshiba's Support line because I was having trouble controlling the external speakers I had connected t o my television through a small Pyle Amplifier.  I chose this amplifier without an IR remote because I was under the impression that the volume could be controlled through the TV's PC Audio Output.  When this would not work, I called in Toshiba's technical support line only for them to tell me volume can only be controlled through a digital audio output (Optical).  I was upset but still OK.  So I ordered the necessary adapters and cables, (Optical Cord, optical to RCA converter to connect to amp) just to find that the television DOES NOT control the audio through either analog or digital output.  Toshiba admitted they told me false information but REFUSES to do anything about it.  I am now in the hole from purchasing the amplifier, original analog cables, and the new digital cable/converter.  SHAME ON YOU TOSHIBA!

Reviews.Title: Bait and Switch - RIP-OFF
Reviews.Author: robyrob
Reviews.Content: ordered the Toshiba 40L5200U when it went on sale for $449.98 with free shipping and the "LOW PRICE GUARANTEE" - what they sent me was a Sansui LCD4050 (yep, not even an LED model) that normally sells for $360 regular price that looks like it had been shipped out and returned a few times (going by the multiple shipping tags on the box).Called Amazon customer service and they informed me that this model is no longer available and the "LOW PRICE GUARANTEE" only applies to items that they currently have in stock - not at the time of order... but they offered me a refund if i return the Sansui ...and that's it.

Reviews.Title: Terribly slow, noticeably cold as a witches heart
Reviews.Author: Indiana Jones
Reviews.Content: The Toshiba 40L5200U 40" 1080p TV is a good example of the industry movingso fast that it has forgotten there is a user who will get stuck with it.  The pictureprocessing works with true HD only and the engineering team disregarded anyconsideration that the user might have regular DVD's to play or not have a cableHD box to drive the screen.  Since this is all additional cost to the user, the manufacturersays "Not my problem".  Well, it IS the manufacturer's problem because sets like thisare going to aggrevate and irritate anyone who buys it.  It is almost unuseable withouta blu-ray disk playing or a cable HD box.  Display of standard cable is awful and theside picture truncation due to standard 4:3 broadcast is almost an insult.  IF the 4:3standard cable did play well, and IF the black level on either side of the 4:3 image wasblack enough to be unnoticeable, THEN life watching this beast would be better.  Displayof most standard DVD's will aggravate you and have you asking: "Why can't the bloodyengineers figure out how to display a regular DVD?" As it is, I say AVOID THESE LARGEHD DISPLAYS UNLESS YOU HAVE MONEY TO BURN.  Technology is a long way awayfrom smart viewing and many people will waste money trying to get there.

Reviews.Title: Decent TV
Reviews.Author: Dr R
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV strictly off the review of it per CNET, I needed a TV for the master and would mostly be watching regular TV and maybe movies at nighttime etc but never intended for a main TV and I would def not recommend it if you're looking for a TV to be your main TV. Out of the box the picture is pretty good. Good black levels to the eye as well as decent shadow detail and blu rays do look crisp and sharp as they should, would recommend putting it in preference mode and tweaking the settings as per recommended on various websites. As an edge lit LCD there is some light bleed in the corners but it is very minimal and only slightly apparent during all black scenes and less than my 8000 series Samsung ironically. Minimal soap opera effect which I like. For an every day TV to watch tv shows and news it will work. On that same note and I've noted this on various LED/LCD's , the lettering of logos on tv stations is a bit blurred, it's not that smooth, nothing big but could annoy you if you care about small things. I still prefer my VT plasma by farrrr but I need an LED in the bedroom because the entire wall is floor to ceiling glass and bright is an understatement.  For 800 bucks though it's def a good buy when you look at what else you can get for 800. If you're looking for a main TV I would recommend a Panasonic plasma as I've never been let down. Overall: decent picture for the buck. Not sure if I'm going to keep it, will update.

Reviews.Title: Bad Smell
Reviews.Author: The Bok
Reviews.Content: The set emits a bad chemical odor.  Had to disconnect power to stop it.  Waiting for Toshiba Tech support to find a solution.Toshiba has reponded to issue by stating " We take this matter seriously.  We will replace the set with an equal or greater value set"  Waiting to hear from trucking company as to when.

Reviews.Title: TV: 5 stars CEVA Ground: 1 Star
Reviews.Author: Trenia
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful TV for the price. The picture is excellent and three HDMI ports is also a nice add on. However, Amazon uses a company called CEVA Ground to deliver this product. I ordered my TV and setup a delivery time 2:00 PM, August 10th. August 6th my TV arrived in New Orleans. August 10th 2:00 PM, I went to check the tracker and it had not updated. CEVA has many problems with their tracker according to reviewers from other sites. I called the company on Friday after my TV had not arrived. They said they did not know where the TV was and to call back Monday. I called back on Monday, and they asked me to setup a delivery time for Wednesday. I sat one up for 10:00-2:00. I waited around that time, and again the TV did not arrive. The delivery man then called me at 3:00 to tell me he was lost, and that his GPS was broken. I live in the suburbs, and my house is very easy to find. I assisted him on the phone for the next 15 minutes. He was a very nice man, but the company as a whole is extremely unprofessional. Reviewers from many other sites have also complained about products arriving late, or not at all. Amazon has never let me down. However, they are contacting CEVA Ground to deliver this product, and they will not deliver your product on time. If you are going to get this TV, order it a week early and expect delays.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT BE FOOLED!!!
Reviews.Author: Anastasia S. Strausser "Anastasia Stacie Stra...
Reviews.Content: Please,do your self a big favor and research this before you buy it. This is, by far the worst TV we have ever purchased. The first day we noticed the sound cutting out. Thought it was the digital provider. But it kept happening and increased in frequency and duration.If you Google the unit you will see an abundance of terrible reviews, sound issues being the majority. After just 3 weeks we returned it to the store and bought a Samsung instead. And the price was comparable! Buyer beware!!

ProductInfo.Features:
Top HD picture quality with 1080p Full HD resolution.
Clear Frame 120Hz: Reduces blurring caused by high-speed video and improves picture clarity without impacting brightness or adding flicker.
Dynamic backlight control for deeper blacks and more detail.
TV without stand (Width x Height x Depth): 41.8'' x 25.2'' x 1.8'', TV with stand (Width x Height x Depth): 41.8'' x 27'' x 10.1''
USB Media: Easily connect to your favorite tunes and photos, create slideshows, or listen to your personal playlists with this feature.
ProductInfo.Name: Toshiba 46L5200U 46-Inch 1080p 120Hz LED TV (Black) (2012 Model)
